title: Viral video of a sexual assault in India sparks outrage and protest
description: An alarming video showing the sexual assault of two women in India went viral Wednesday, sparking public outcry over two months after it was filmed.

title: Spain has been a progressive model. Now far-right Vox has a shot at power.
description: An alliance between the center-right and Vox would give Spain its most conservative government since the death of Franco.

title: A lioness is on the loose near Berlin, police suspect. But whose is it?
description: A caller reported seeing a wild animal running through a village near Berlin around midnight. Police say they think it's a lioness — but none have been reported missing.

title: Iraq orders expulsion of Swedish ambassador over Quran controversy
description: The order came after a mob stormed the Swedish embassy in Baghdad in response to a protest held in Sweden that involved the desecration of the Quran, Islam's holy book.

title: Rich lode of EV metals could boost Taliban and its new Chinese partners
description: Afghanistan may have the world’s largest lithium reserves. Chinese entrepreneurs are eager to help the country’s Taliban rulers exploit them.

title: This mayor, tired of poop on his streets, is making dogs get passports
description: Robert Ménard, mayor of Béziers, France, is requiring owners to submit their dogs' DNA and carry passports. They will be fined if poop is traced back to them.

title: Roald Dahl museum condemns author’s ‘undeniable’ racism
description: The Roald Dahl Museum and Story Center in Britain says it is working to combat hate and antisemitism, and is "working hard to do better."

title: Cerberus. Charon. Gary? Heat wave naming debate intensifies in Europe.
description: Europe seems to want to name extreme heat events. But what naming system to use, which forecasts warrant names and who should make the calls are far from settled.

title: Ukraine begins firing U.S.-provided cluster munitions at Russian forces
description: President Biden invoked a national security exception to U.S. law to supply Ukraine with the controversial weapons, which are prohibited in more than 120 countries.

title: Ukraine’s new Bradley Fighting Vehicles face damage and quick repairs
description: Western-provided equipment, including American Bradley Fighting Vehicles and German Leopard tanks, are saving Ukrainian soldiers' lives but are a target for Russia.

title: You might notice some new flags at the World Cup. Here’s why it’s a big deal.
description: Aboriginal and the Torres Strait Islander flags will be flown at soccer games in Australia, and the Maori flag in New Zealand. What do they symbolize?

title: Ukraine live briefing: Third night of missile strikes in Odessa region; at least 18 injured in Mykolaiv attack
description: The strikes follow Moscow’s termination of a deal that helped Ukrainian grain reach international markets and come after Kyiv’s strike on the Crimean Bridge.

title: Egypt pardons two prominent political prisoners
description: Egypt announced presidential pardons for two political prisoners on Wednesday, including one who had been sentenced on Tuesday.
